conclusion: Analyze the flow direction and placement of baffles to determine which container liquid will flow into.
Baffles A, B, and C block the direct path of the liquid.
Liquid will have to follow the path around the baffles.
Baffle A is positioned horizontally at the top of the image.
Baffle A will likely cause the liquid to flow downward.
Baffle B is positioned diagonally from top left to bottom right.
Baffle B will cause the liquid to flow in a diagonal path.
Baffle C is positioned horizontally at the top of the image.
Baffle C will likely cause the liquid to flow downward.
After passing through baffle A, the liquid will flow downward.
After passing through baffle B, the liquid will flow in a diagonal path.
After passing through baffle C, the liquid will flow downward again.
Container D is located on the left side of the image.
Container E is located on the right side of the image.
Liquid flows downward after passing through baffle A and baffle C, eventually reaching container E.
The diagonal path caused by baffle B does not significantly change the overall downward flow pattern.
Liquid will flow into container E after passing through baffles A, B, and C.
